Know that the gifts of Jesus are for the equipping of the saints, the work of the ministry and for the building up and teaching of the church.
Know that the gifts of Jesus are to enable all in the body of Christ to unite in the faith and in relationhip with Jesus  to attain spiritual maturity and become fully like Christ.
Know that Jesus is our role model. (He is the best illustration of how to live a Christian life.)
Don’t allow yourself to remain spiritually immature.
Know that the spiritually immature are tossed to and fro and carried about with every wind of doctrine.
Beware those who, by the skillful trickery of false doctrine, lie in wait to deceive you.
Act and speak sincerely in love.
Seek to grow spiritually to become spiritually mature and like Jesus in every way.
Know that as head of the church Jesus leads by example.

Know that it is God’s intention that the whole body is tightly joined together and brought closer in unity through the supply of every joint as each individual works effectively together to supply the needs of the body causing it to grow in number and to be built up further in love.
Know that the Christian faith is not to be lived in isolation from the body of Christ.
Know that everyone in the body of Christ has a unique gifting from Christ and part to play.
Know that every part of the body (including you) is needed!
Know that God’s plan for your life will benefit others in the body of Christ.
Stop behaving like other Gentiles who live only for their own futile pursuits and vain thoughts.
Know that the Gentiles live in spiritual darkness without understanding and do not live for God.
Know that the Gentiles are ignorant because of the hardness of their hearts.
Know that the Gentiles are insensitive to spiritual matters and prefer to indulge their sensual appetites pleasing their flesh and natural desires in all kinds of impurity.
Know that the Gentiles are never satisfied but continually lust after ways that are even more ungodly.
Know that Jesus did not teach you to live like other Gentiles.
Know that Jesus wants us to hear Him so that He can teach us the truth.
Know that the truth is found in Jesus.
Know that if you have heard and been taught the truth by Jesus then you can no longer live and behave as you did before according to your old nature.
Choose to lay aside your old sinful nature and behaviours.
Know that your old nature was corrupted by selfish and deceitful desires.
Be renewed in the spirit of your mind.
Change your mind and adopt the mindset of Christ.
Change the way that you think because of what God has done for you and because of what you are learning about God.
Having chosen to lay aside your old nature, now clothe yourself in righteousness and true holiness after the likeness of God.
Stop telling lies and always speak the truth to everyone.
Speak the truth to everyone because we are all members of one another (the body of Christ).
Be angry without sinning.
Don’t hold on to your anger; be rid of it before the end of the day.
Don’t give the devil any room to operate anywhere in your life.
Don’t listen to the false accusations or give in to the temptations of the devil.
Stop stealing and work hard instead.
Work hard so that you may have to give to those in need.
Know that work is not just to satisfy your own needs but also those of others.
Let no bad or worthless words come out of your mouth.
Do not speak in an impure or critical way.
Speak kind and encouraging words that bless and build up those who hear.
Do not make the Holy Spirit of God sorrowful by the way that you speak or act.

Know that the Holy Spirit is God’s mark of ownership upon us that reserves us as His until the day of redemption when we will all be resurrected, changed and receive our resurrected bodies (The Rapture).
Put all bitterness away from you so that you no longer bear grudges or hatred towards anyone.
Put all anger and resentment away from you.
Do not get into heated disputes and shout loud and angry complaints and demands.
Stop all negative, slanderous and evil speaking.
Put away all spiteful thoughts, revenge and unprovoked ill-will towards others.
Become kind to one another.
Become compassionate and sympathetic to one another.
Forgive one another, just as God has forgiven you for Christ’s sake.
As a beloved child of God, seek to become an imitator of God your Father who is kind, compassionate and forgiving.
Small children sometimes mimic their parents but as beloved children of God imitation is a necessity.
Live a life full of love, imitating God by loving others just as Jesus loved us. [John 13:34]
Remember that Jesus gave His life for us as an offering and a sacrifice which was pleasing to God.
Remember that Jesus died in our place for our sins. [Romans 5:8]
Know that true love gives oneself for others. [John 15:13]
Offer fragrance to God by sacrificially living for others.
Know that God had an eternal purpose for the life and death of Jesus.
Know that God uses death with purpose for those impacted by it.
Do not compromise. Give no one any cause whatsoever to accuse you of sexual immorality, impurity, idolatry or greed.
Do not commit illicit sexual intercourse such as adultery, homosexuality, lesbianism, bestiality or incest.
Do not become defiled through moral impurity or sinfulness.
Do not commit idolatry; the desertion of the worship of the true God for the worship of idols.
Do not become obsessed with the possession of worldly things or the accumulation of wealth.
Know that neither sexual immorality, impurity, idolatry nor greed is to have any place whatsoever in the body of Christ.
Do not behave in a shameful or obscene manner.
Do not speak in an obscene manner or participate in foolish talking or jokes in bad taste.
Instead of speaking things that are not fitting, give thanks to God.
Know that there is not any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God for any immoral, impure or greedy person.
Let no one deceive you with vain words that all will go to heaven.
Know that God’s anger will come upon the children of disobedience because of immorality, impurity and greed.
Do not participate in the ways of the children of disobedience.
Remember that you once walked in darkness without understanding but now, in Christ, you have the light of life.
Walk as a child of God in the light of the knowledge of God.
Know that the evidence of the Holy Spirit in anyone is always goodness, righteousness and truth.
Walk in the light of God’s truth discerning and doing what is well pleasing to God.
Do not participate in works of darkness which are sinful and unprofitable but rather confront those who do and expose their shameful works convicting them of their fault.
Know that it is shameful even to talk about the things done privately and in secret by the children of disobedience.
Know that light confronts works of darkness exposing them for what they really are and convicting those who participate in them of their sin.

Know that God is saying to those who are spiritually dead to awake from their sleep and rise up from the dead so that Christ may shine the light of truth upon them and give them life. [Romans 13:11-14]
Know that only the light of Jesus will stop you stumbling in the darkness and show you the right way to go.
Do not live foolishly.
Live wisely and walk surely.

Do not be unwise but instead understanding and doing God’s will.

Don’t seek satisfaction through temptations like alcohol but instead be fulfilled by the Holy Spirit, speaking and singing to yourself and making melody in your heart to the Lord.
Continually give thanks to your heavenly Father for all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Know that the Church is set apart exclusively and permanently for relationship with God.

Remember that you are a member of the body of Christ (the Church).

Be obedient to the people in authority over you.

Whether you are in authority or under authority, seek to serve and please God, not men.
Know that whatsoever good thing any man does, the same shall he receive of the Lord, whether he is under authority or not.
Know that the Lord rewards all good works.

Know that God is no respecter of persons and is impartial and good to all.
Be strong in the Lord and in the power of His might.
Know that all our strength and abilities come from the Lord.
Remember that the Holy Spirit is at work within us, enabling us to do more than we could ever imagine through His power and might.
Live to demonstrate the mighty works of the Lord.
Put on the whole armour of God so that you may be able to stand against the sly trickery and traps of the devil.
Take a firm stand against the devil and his followers.
Know that the devil will try to harm, trap and deceive you.
Be thankful to God that He provides us with a defence and protection against the devil.
Know that our battle is not against people (flesh and blood).

Wrestle against the principalities, authorities and rulers of the darkness of this world.
Wrestle against spiritual wickedness in heavenly places.
Take up and use the whole armour of God so that you may be able to resist and oppose when evil attacks.

Remain steadfast and resist when evil attacks and do all to remain standing.
Stand wearing truth as a belt, knowing that it is God’s truth that supports and holds everything together in your life.
Put on the breastplate of His righteousness and keep it close to your heart.
Be ready to take the good news of Christ and His peace with you everywhere you go.
Take the shield of faith, your most important protection, that will enable you to overcome everything that the enemy throws at you.

Take the helmet of salvation and keep receipt of it firmly in your mind.
Take the sword of the Spirit (the Word of God) as both a weapon and a defence.
Pray continually in conversation with the Holy Spirit, vigilantly obeying and earnestly bringing your petitions to God for you and your brethren in Christ.
Pray for those who minister to you, that they may be given the words to speak boldly to make the gospel known.
Take note that Paul remained an ambassador of the truth even when imprisoned.
Don’t minister in isolation, work with your brethren in the Lord and share your experiences openly with others.
Share your ministry experiences and be a comfort and an encouragement to others.

Take note that Paul ends his letter to the Ephesians the same way that he started it, again using the full title of "Lord Jesus Christ" and again wishing more grace and peace be imparted to the saints from God the Father and from the Lord Jesus Christ, together with love and faith to those who truly love the Lord Jesus Christ.
Know that the fruits of righteousness are by Jesus Christ unto the glory and praise of God.
Humble yourself.

Don’t allow your belly to become your God.
Know that we are citizens of heaven.

Let your requests be made known to God in prayer with thanksgiving.

Learn to be content in whatever situation you are in.
Know that you can do all things through Christ who strengthens you.

Know that you are holy and blameless in God’s sight without accusation.

Know that Jesus is seated above at the right hand of God in heaven.
Seek the things that are above where Christ is seated.

Husbands, love your wives and do not be bitter towards them.

Know that God shows no respect of persons when passing judgement.
Turn from idols to serve the living and true God.

Be patient with everyone.
Pray without ceasing.
Be content with having food and clothing.
Know that Paul was chosen by God to be an ambassador of Jesus Christ.
Know that grace, mercy and peace come from God our Father and His Son, our Lord, Jesus, the Messiah.
Remember others in your prayers every day without ceasing.
Encourage others in their faith.
Stir up the gift of God that is in you.
Keep the fire of God burning brightly within you.
Make full use of the gifts of the Holy Spirit that is in you.

Know that Paul’s mission was to the Gentiles.
Be strong in the grace that is in Jesus Christ.

Do not entangle yourself in the affairs of this life.
Do not concern yourself with the present circumstances you find yourself in.
Seek to please Him who has chosen you to be a soldier.
Know that the Lord will give you all the understanding you need.

Know that if we died with Him we shall also live with Him.

Study to show your acceptance by God as a teacher correctly able to explain the Word of God.
Avoid ungodly conversation as it only produces more ungodliness.
Know that the foundations of God stand sure.
Know that the Lord knows those who are His.
Know that everyone who names the name of Jesus must depart from sin.
Purge yourself to become a vessel of honour ready for every good work.
Flee youthful lusts.
Run from the evil desires of youth.
Run after righteousness, faith, love and peace.
Avoid foolish and ignorant questions knowing that they lead to arguments.

Humbly instruct those who oppose you.

Deny ungodliness and worldly lusts.
Be subject to principalities and powers.

Know that Jesus has a more excellent name than the angels.

Know that God sees all things and that nothing is hidden from Him.
Know that God sees all things and we must each give account for our self.
Know that Jesus was tempted in every way that we are yet was without sin.
Come boldly to the throne of grace to obtain mercy and help in time of need.
Approach the throne of grace with confidence.
Know that God has chosen to remember our sins no more.
Know that you have a clean conscience through the blood of Christ.
Know that the blood of Jesus cleanses our conscience from dead works.
Be content with the things that you have.
Know that God said He will never leave you or forsake you.

Obey them that have rule over you and submit to them.
Count it all joy when you fall into various temptations.

Learn to trust and wait on God.
Know that God allows you to go through trials so that you might become perfect and entire, wanting nothing.

Ask God in faith without doubting.

Know that every good and perfect gift comes down from the Father above.

Be a doer of the word and not a hearer only.

Do not bless and curse.

Praise Him who called you out of darkness into His marvellous light.

Honour all men.
Love the brotherhood.

Be vigilant.
Increase in grace and peace through the knowledge of God and Jesus.

Love one another.

Do not love in word but in deed and in truth.
Know that when we please Him we receive everything we ask of Him.

Love one another as Jesus commanded.
